title: Intel version of the app does not launch

labels.name: priority 0: blocker
labels.description: an issues that requires immediate attention and that causes the app to not work at all (e.g a crash)

milestone.description:
- minting fee calculation fix
- community nav fix
- fix waku sync/fetch
- intel build fix

body: ### Description Try to launch https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/releases/download/0.11.0/StatusIm-Desktop-v0.11.0-621f0c-x86_64.dmg (it is latest release 0.11.0 intel build) ``` anastasiya@MacBook-Pro-Anastasiya MacOS % ./nim_status_client INFO [04-17|13:40:11.679] Status backend initialized backend=geth version=0.143.0 commit=1754c2376 IpfsGatewayURL=https://ipfs.status.im/ INF 2023-04-17 13:40:12.550+03:00 Version: 0.11.0 topics="status-app" tid=2141493 file=nim_status_client.nim:186 INF 2023-04-17 13:40:12.551+03:00 Commit: 621f0c229 topics="status-app" tid=2141493 file=nim_status_client.nim:187 INF 2023-04-17 13:40:12.551+03:00 Current date: topics="status-app" tid=2141493 file=nim_status_client.nim:188 currentDateTime=2023-04-17T13:40:12+03:00 INF 2023-04-17 13:40:12.551+03:00 starting application controller... topics="status-app" tid=2141493 file=nim_status_client.nim:190 Warning: libpng warning: iCCP: known incorrect sRGB profile (:0, ) Debug: Network Cache Dir: "/Users/anastasiya/Library/Application Support/Status/tmp/netcache" (:0, ) ```
originally spotted by @qoqobolo
@jrainville @iurimatias
For me it hangs on start
@MishkaRogachev thanks for checking, it is the same for me as well
@MishkaRogachev can you `strace` it to see where it hangs (or what file is it trying to open)? I have a suspicion it might be related to https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10331
@MishkaRogachev anything in geth.log?

I faced some problems running `strace/dtrace/dtruss` on Mac, i'll try again tomorrow

> @MishkaRogachev can you `strace` it to see where it hangs (or what file is it trying to open)? I have a suspicion it might be related to #10331

@caybro hmmmm, I don't think this has anything to do with https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/issues/10331.
If it was about that issue, it would either fail to build on linking stage, or it would crash at runtime with smth like "import StatusQ no found.

> @caybro hmmmm, I don't think this has anything to do with #10331. If it was about that issue, it would either fail to build on linking stage, or it would crash at runtime with smth like "import StatusQ no found.

Hmmm maybe, I don't know... for me it doesn't crash either, just hangs with the "import StatusQ not found" error. The thing is that here we're dealing with a release build that might not print any such warning at all

Current state of investigation:
Tested on M1 release versions:
v0.11.0-rc.4-38d2d4-aarch64 - works
v0.11.0-621f0c-x86_64  - fail
v0.11.0-621f0c-aarch64 - works

Log for x86_64 launch:
```
INF 2023-04-18 21:54:09.979+04:00 Version: 0.11.0                            topics="status-app" tid=1026712 file=nim_status_client.nim:186
INF 2023-04-18 21:54:09.979+04:00 Commit: 621f0c229                          topics="status-app" tid=1026712 file=nim_status_client.nim:187
INF 2023-04-18 21:54:09.980+04:00 Current date:                              topics="status-app" tid=1026712 file=nim_status_client.nim:188 currentDateTime=2023-04-18T21:54:09+04:00
INF 2023-04-18 21:54:09.980+04:00 starting application controller...         topics="status-app" tid=1026712 file=nim_status_client.nim:190
INF 2023-04-18 21:54:28.418+04:00 starting application...                    topics="status-app" tid=1026712 file=nim_status_client.nim:193
```
Next it supposed to be 
```
ERR 2023-04-18 21:50:51.311+04:00 error:                                     topics="accounts-service" tid=1024213 file=service.nim:600 procName=verifyDatabasePassword errDesription="file is not a database"
```

I tried to re-run pipeline from 0.11.0 branch:

- [aarch64](https://ci.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/branches/job/macos/job/aarch64/job/package/view/change-requests/job/PR-10356/) works for me
- [x86-64](https://ci.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/branches/job/macos/job/x86_64/job/package/view/change-requests/job/PR-10356/) fails

[Master](https://ci.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/branches/job/macos/job/x86_64/job/package/view/change-requests/job/PR-10357/) branch also fails
Intel [build](https://ci.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/branches/job/macos/job/x86_64/job/package/view/change-requests/job/PR-10361/) for the [initial PR](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/9869) works 
And this [one](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/10210) does not
Hi @MishkaRogachev , I can confirm that the package does not work (hangs on launch) and the the the PR, when built locally, does launch for both arm and x86_64.

> Hi @MishkaRogachev , I can confirm that the package does not work (hangs on launch) and the the the PR, when built locally, does launch for both arm and x86_64.

Thanks! That makes me fill it somehow related with Qt version? Are you on 5.15.2 or 5.15.8?
When launching the app it asks for the touch-id, and immediately goes to a not responding state. I'm using an intel mac.

> Thanks! That makes me fill it somehow related with Qt version? Are you on 5.15.2 or 5.15.8?

My intel version is 5.15.2 and the arm version is 5.15.8

UPD: Tested also release builds (RELEASE=false VERBOSE=0 make pkg)
@jrainville I have no idea what to do with this task next :(
@jakubgs can you check the Intel Mac hosts? What version of Qt do they have? Is there a difference between the Intel and ARM hosts?

You can check what version they have yourself:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/8163293e16a45f41b782ed3b683ce3bfbf2b0345/ci/Jenkinsfile.macos#L49-L51
It's Qt installed via Brew. As we discussed in the M1 build issue.

But just for clarity here's the actual current version on all MacOS hosts:
```
 > a ci-slave-macos -o -a 'readlink /opt/homebrew/opt/qt@5'   
maci7-03.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
maci7-02.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
maci7-01.ms-eu-dublin.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
macm1-01.ih-eu-mda1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
macm1-02.he-eu-fsn1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
macm1-01.he-eu-fsn1.ci.devel | CHANGED | rc=0 | (stdout) ../Cellar/qt@5/5.15.8_2
```

We need someone with an Intel Mac to try to build locally (with make package), to see if that works. Also, They can easily check if the QT version is the culrpit.

@status-im/desktop anyone still have an Intel Mac?
@qoqobolo can u please assist?

> @qoqobolo can u please assist?

Sure. How can I do this? 
UPD: Sale is already on it. Feel free to ping me if my help is still needed.

Can be reproduced on M1 dev env when linking against x86_64 qt installation 5.15.8 installed with brew.

Repro steps:
```
arch --x86_64 /bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/HEAD/install.sh)"
arch --x86_64 /usr/local/Homebrew/bin/brew install qt@5
export QTDIR="usr/local/opt/qt@5"
export Qt5_DIR="${QTDIR}"
export PATH=${QTDIR}/bin:$PATH
make -j10 clean
make -j10 update
make -j10 run
```

The renderer thread is crashing :(

Works fine with `QSG_RENDER_LOOP=basic`. We force the renderer thread to threaded from DOtherSide in order for the splash screen not to freeze.
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/7757c3b47d518ca7698d09a610b7864065cc38db/vendor/DOtherSide/lib/src/DOtherSide.cpp#L176-L184

Would be interesting to see how it behaves on Intel Macs so that we can update the condition properly. Currently we exclude `arm64` MacOs builds. If it works fine on Intel Macs I guess we can exclude M1 CPUs.
Thanks @saledjenic for building x86_64 version on Intel:  https://drive.google.com/file/d/1xypLhUzlU5s3MW3LHlCQA1q9OXa0tD4t/view
@alexjba thank you for investigation! I did not know that its possible to install x86_64 Qt with brew. x86_64 version installed with Qt Maintenance Tool worked fine for me
Yeah, we should just disable it for Macs
